moves.1. e4: i like the Spanish opening so i played e4
moves.1... e5 2. Nf3 d5:
oO i don't know the name of this opening but i know that black wastes many tempi and white can develop
##
edit: it's the Elephant Gambit
moves.3. exd5 Qxd5 4. Nc3: see? 2 white knights came out while black just developed its queen, which is now attacked
moves.4... Qc5 5. d4: to undo black's opening i thought a queen trade might be good to increase my development advantage
moves.5... exd4 6. Qxd4 Qxd4 7. Nxd4: black is undeveloped while white has opened the table
moves.7... Bc5 8. Be3: a trade on d4 is good for white because of the threat on g7/h8 from the white bishop
moves.10. O-O-O: white too but with a more active postion of the rook
moves.10... Bxd4 11. Bxd4: if i trade on f6 the g-line would be open which is good for white
moves.11... Ng4: i don't know what the intention is but maybe the fork on f2 if i move my bishop from d4 away
moves.12. Rd3: trying to threaten with Rg3 followed by 14.Rxg7+ Kh8 15.Rg6+ f6 16.Bxf6+ Rxf6 17.Rxf6 with material advatage for white
moves.12... g6 13. Nd5: all my plans destroyed -.- but why not try to play Nd5 and threaten a mate?
